alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Summers; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:21PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Greenbrier and northeastern Summers Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 921 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Summersville to near Bingham to near Piney View. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rainelle... Rupert... Quinwood... Renick... Falling Spring... Asbury... and Beartown State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
